net.slightlymagic.braids.util.progress_monitor
Interface ProgressMonitor

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseProgressMonitor, MultiPhaseProgressMonitorWithETA, StderrProgressMonitor
public interface ProgressMonitor

Interface for a progress monitor that can have multiple phases and periodically update its UI. All times must be in seconds; absolute times are measured in seconds since 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 UTC (GMT) a la (new Date().getTime()/1000).

Method Detail

getNumPhases

int getNumPhases()
Returns:
the total number of phases monitored by this object.

getMinUpdateIntervalSec

float getMinUpdateIntervalSec()
Returns:
the approximate minimum interval in seconds at which the UI should be updated.

getCurrentPhase

int getCurrentPhase()
Returns:
the current phase number; this is never less than 1 (one).

getUnitsCompletedSoFarThisPhase

long getUnitsCompletedSoFarThisPhase()
Returns:
the number of units (an intentionally vague amount) completed so far in the current phase.

getTotalUnitsThisPhase

long getTotalUnitsThisPhase()
Returns:
the total units we expect to process in this phase

getLastUIUpdateTime

long getLastUIUpdateTime()
Returns:
the time in absolute seconds since the UI was last updated

getPhaseOneStartTime

long getPhaseOneStartTime()
Returns:
the time in absolute seconds at which the first phase started

getCurrentPhaseStartTime

long getCurrentPhaseStartTime()
Returns:
the time in absolute seconds at which the current phase started

setMinUpdateIntervalSec

void setMinUpdateIntervalSec(float value)
Parameters:
value - the approximate time in relative seconds at which the UI should be updated periodically

setTotalUnitsThisPhase

void setTotalUnitsThisPhase(long value)
Parameters:
value - the total number of units expected to processed in this phase

getPercentCompleteOfThisPhaseAsString

String getPercentCompleteOfThisPhaseAsString()
Resulting string does not contain a percent sign.

Returns:
the percentage completion of this phase as a String with no percent sign.

getTotalPercentCompleteAsString

String getTotalPercentCompleteAsString()
Resulting string does not contain a percent sign.

Returns:
the percentage completion at this point, taking into account all phases and phase-weights, as a String with no percent sign.

getRelativeETAAsString

String getRelativeETAAsString(boolean thisPhaseOnly)
May return "unknown"

getAbsoluteETAAsLocalTimeString

String getAbsoluteETAAsLocalTimeString(boolean thisPhaseOnly)
May return "unknown"

incrementUnitsCompletedThisPhase

void incrementUnitsCompletedThisPhase(long numUnits)
Note this will NOT advance the phase. To do that, use markCurrentPhaseAsComplete().

shouldUpdateUI

boolean shouldUpdateUI()
Returns a boolean, whether or not to display the updated information. This throttles the update so it doesn't refresh so fast that it is unreadable. Implementers should call this method from their own incrementUnitsCompletedThisPhase method. If we have just reached 100% for (the current phase, we return true, even if it would otherwise be too soon to update the UI.

markCurrentPhaseAsComplete

void markCurrentPhaseAsComplete(long totalUnitsNextPhase)
This is the only way to advance the phase number. It automatically "starts the clock" for the next phase.

Parameters:
totalUnitsNextPhase - if unknown, use zero (0), and be sure to call setTotalUnitsThisPhase() soon after.

sendMessage

void sendMessage(String message)
Attempt to display a message to the user; not all implementations support this. If they do not, they may silently ignore this call.

Parameters:
message - the message to display

setCurrentPhaseAsExponential

void setCurrentPhaseAsExponential(float value)
Mark the current phase as having an exponential rate; such phases reach their totalUnits slower and slower as they process more units. By default, a phase is considered to be linear, meaning this value is 1.0f.

Parameters:
value - usually less than 1.0f; often determined empirically.

getCurrentPhaseExponent

float getCurrentPhaseExponent()
Returns:
the exponent for this phase
